About.title: Little about me
About.p1: I'm a software engineer based in Montreal with a passion for solving real-life problems through coding. After briefly pursuing a career in soccer, I realized coding was my true calling. Now, as a full stack engineer at GoTo, I face new challenges daily, and continue working on personal projects in my free time. My competitive mindset, honed from sports, drives my work ethic and passion for development.

Introduction.I'm a full-stack developer with backgrou: I'm a fullstack developer with background experience in building complex platforms and designs.

Soft.title: My soft skills
Soft.adaptability: Quickly adjust to new situations or requirements
Soft.learning: Hungry for new knowledge and skills
Soft.problemSolving: Identify and resolve complex issues efficiently
Soft.resilience: Very good at motivating myself because I take joy in coding
Soft.teamwork: Collaborate effectively with others towards common goals

Cloud.title: Infrastructure stack
Cloud.tools: Used Terraform and Ansible in some projects I run (mostly pickside)
Cloud.aws: AWS -> Knows a lot about EC2, ECS, ECR and many more...
Cloud.experience: Always trying different tools, and compare cost & services between them
Cloud.challenges: Understand cloud cost challenges and always looking for the best way to minimize cost on services

Dev.title: Software stack
Dev.authentication: Built my own authentication server for my pickside app project. Great way to learn how it's done.
Dev.stack: I use Go and React/Tailwind/CSS everyday. Also learning C in my free time.
Dev.docker: I use Docker every day for local development + as a deployment tool.
Dev.versionning: I use Git everyday and Github for versionning my projects.

Devops.title: Devops knowledge
Devops.integration: Worked in several multi-system integration environments
Devops.microservices: Know how to work in a microservice driven project
Devops.automation: Know how to automate a development process using tools like Github actions, Jenkins or Concourse
Devops.security: Understand the importance of security practices such as using a vault storing secrets
Devops.commits: Use semantic commits when coding, drafts release every functionning version
Devops.scripts: Program small scripts that help me in my automation process such as upgrading & commiting a new version for a microservice
Devops.containerize: Containerize my services for easy deployment

Contact.title: Contact
Contact.Description: If you are looking for someone to work with or even just to discuss, please feel free to contact me.

Design.title: Design
Design.a: A figma design with of how your website will look like
Design.b: Unlimited calls to go over your design

SinglePage.title: One page
SinglePage.a: Could be a portfolio to showcase your skills
SinglePage.b: Could be a blog page that will allow you to post content about your favorite subjects
SinglePage.d: Could be an event promotion website

Custom.title: Custom
Custom.e: Will include SEO (Search engine Optimization) to index your website amongst the first results

Resume.Summary: Senior fullstack engineer with over 6 years of experience designing, developing, and scaling user-focused platforms. Expertise in leading complex migrations, optimizing performance, and implementing robust, scalable architectures. Proven track record in driving cross-functional collaboration, mentoring teams, and delivering impactful solutions in high-pressure environments.

GoTo.summary: I focus on building and enhancing a SaaS business platform, ensuring it’s reliable, user-friendly, and equipped with features that add real value.
GoTo.a: Spearheaded the User Sync tool implementation, automating bulk updates with custom rules, enabling 94% migration of legacy users to the new platform.
GoTo.b: Designed advanced configuration options in collaboration with cross-functional teams, reducing user onboarding time by 30%.
GoTo.c: Re-architected privilege systems to resolve critical access issues, boosting platform reliability and trust.
GoTo.d: Built support for billing administrators, enabling 100% user migration from a legacy platform.
GoTo.e: Refactored admin features for modularity, improving development speed and maintainability.

Desjardins.summary: Worked on a secure messaging platform where users could share sensitive documents and messages. Learned a ton about security and building microservices, especially how to make solid REST APIs and pipelines.
Desjardins.a: Led frontend development with TypeScript and StencilJS, establishing robust coding standards and reusable patterns.
Desjardins.b: Developed a REST API for secure authentication using Spring Boot and PKCE, supporting microservices architecture.
Desjardins.c: Delivered 20+ reusable micro-frontend components, enhancing consistency and development efficiency.
Desjardins.d: Implemented CI/CD pipelines with 80%+ test coverage, streamlining reliable deployments.

Bell.summary: Helped build an internal dashboard (think JIRA-lite) that made team stand-ups way easier and saved them a ton of time. I also got to work on both the frontend and backend, which was a great learning experience.
Bell.a: Designed a dashboard integrating with an SAP database, reducing team workload by 5 hours per week and boosting productivity by 70%.
Bell.b: Mentored teammates in EmberJS, improving team productivity and technical expertise.
Bell.c: Optimized relational database queries, enhancing performance by 2% in high-load scenarios.

Ubisoft.summary: This was my first job as an intern, where I fell in love with frontend dev. I built widgets with PolymerJS (a Google library) and learned the ropes of component-based design.
Ubisoft.a: Developed iFrame widgets using PolymerJS and TypeScript, enhancing dashboard communication and user metric tracking.
Ubisoft.b: Contributed to agile development with unit-tested, scalable widgets.
Ubisoft.c: Got hands-on with agile development, which was a great intro to how real teams work.
Ubisoft.d: Wrote unit tests to make sure my widgets were solid and ready to go.
Ubisoft.e: Sat through 100+ meetings and learned a lot about teamwork and communication in a big company.

Discord.summary: Built a Discord bot with music queue functionality to make things more fun for my friends and me.
Discord.a: Developed a bot using Python and NodeJS, featuring a custom queue system with controls for play, pause, next, and previous.
Discord.b: Set up hosting on an EC2 instance with pm2 to ensure the bot runs 24/7 without interruptions.
Discord.c: Automated the EC2 setup with Ansible and Terraform, saving time and streamlining deployments.

Pickside.summary: Pickside is a platform in development for planning sports events, finding teams, and managing venues.
Pickside.summarywithstack: Pickside: Event planning app – Built with React, Golang, Docker, AWS, and a home server for hosting and CI/CD.
Pickside.a: Developed a scalable event planning app with authentication, role-based functionality, and CRUD operations using React, Golang, and AWS.
Pickside.b: Integrated background tasks to support notification dispatch using goroutines, with plans to transition to a real-time notification system.
Pickside.c: Designed the platform to support 10,000+ users, ensuring robustness and scalability for future growth.

PortfolioV1.summary: My first portfolio project, built with React to showcase my skills and work.
PortfolioV1.summarywithstack: Portfolio V1 - Built with React and TailwindCSS, hosted on AWS via S3.
PortfolioV1.a: Built and iterated on a personal portfolio with React and Next.js, adding features like bilingual support, PDF resume downloads, and dynamic functionality.

PortfolioV2.summary: A more polished version of my portfolio, using Next.js and TypeScript for a modern look and feel.
PortfolioV2.summarywithstack: Portfolio V2 - Built with Next.js, TypeScript, and TailwindCSS, hosted on Vercel.
PortfolioV2.a: Deployed on AWS S3 and Vercel for performance and scalability.

Sadbois.summary: An e-commerce store project for selling homemade t-shirts. It was never completed, but I gained valuable experience.
Sadbois.a: Designed a basic e-commerce site using React 16 (pre-hooks) and a C# backend.
Sadbois.b: Implemented features like a functional cart, user login, and partial PayPal integration.
Sadbois.c: Used a home-hosted MySQL server to manage backend data.
Sadbois.d: Learned about database migrations to streamline development and setup processes.
